message: Hello guys, so I wrote a small python program that uses imported packages, how do I run it on another environment without having to import the packages again?

data.message: I don't think that's what I meant, what I meant is I need a way to package the imports with my project so when I run it anywhere I don't need to import the packages again. Like compiling an exe.
for example, my program uses numpy and sklearn, I want to run it on other computers that don't have those installed. Can I do that?

If you are distributing it to technical audience or power users use pip
http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/shipping/packaging/

if you are distributing to end users, you need to freeze your code 
http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/shipping/freezing/#freezing-your-code-ref
Use something like pyinstaller to Freeze it.
http://www.pyinstaller.org/
